title: What is the creative process of knowledge according to this text and how does it relate to the idea of "creation"?
first_phrase: In this text by Italian philosopher Luigi Pareyson, titled "What is Metaphysics?", he delves into the concept of knowledge as an active and antidualistic process. In the last 200 tokens, Pareyson clarifies the term "creative state" in relation to consciousness and the dynamic nature of reality. He argues that every existing form has a creative and dynamic principle, and the process of knowledge can transform and create new meaning out of it. Pareyson reminds us that these processes are not non-existent, but rather latent in the subconsciousness, waiting to be brought back into consciousness.

Rispetto all'Io, non si può dire che detti pro- cessi « non esistono ancora »; si deve invece dire che nel- l'esistenza corporea essi passano ad uno stato di tacitazione, di subcoscienza, analogo a quello in cui passa un'attività che diviene automatica. Le forze dello stato dinamico fanno parte dell'Io, e mai hanno cessato di farne parte. Si tratta di un loro rientrare nel campo della coscienza.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the notion of creating something that did not exist before is not what it is commonly perceived to be. The reality is that the consciousness of this relationship did not exist before. Therefore, everyone is a creator, and it is only a matter of becoming aware of it. This transformation is best described as an awakening. The concept of creating, in its modern and idealistic sense, presupposes a starting point with something to increase. However, the initiatic view believes that the original state of being has no more but potentially less.
